Description: Body sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Gordion cup; interior: part of tondo border; row of dots outside two narrow bands and part of frieze of alternating red and black tongues; teo narrow bands to the centre; exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1948,0815.5, 1948, 0815.6 and 1948,0815.8. The pieces are gathered in Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., pl. 42. If the connection is correct this piece is from a black-figured cup.
Bibliographic references: Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (No G4; p. 556) (Ergotimos-Kleitias Group)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0427) (Phase 1)
